subject: Re: QSJ Block
msgSnippet: Random observation: The loops in your letters occasionally lose their holes, becoming dots.  They probably need hinting, but it only affects legibility when
messageBody:
Random observation:

The loops in your letters occasionally lose their holes, becoming
dots. They probably need hinting, but it only affects legibility
when trying to recognize V as the jM digraph. At least for me.

OTOH, I really enjoy your I and N. They are pleasing variants on
the original letters.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "tinyallen" <Tinyallen@y...>
wrote:
> Has anyone seen the "QSJ Block" font I created? I would welcome
a
> detailed critique - or even a few observations.
> I used the trial period of a tool (Fontographer) to create it,
and
> will purchase it in a few months.

Random observation:

The loops in your letters occasionally lose their holes, becoming 
dots.  They probably need hinting, but it only affects legibility 
when trying to recognize V as the jM digraph.  At least for me.

OTOH, I really enjoy your I and N.  They are pleasing variants on 
the original letters.
